Show HN: GitHub Based Accommodation
text:
Hi all, A few years ago, I wanted to have other interesting people stay over in our spare room.

To invite Hackers/doers/makers/conference speakers, there is no "interesting" filter on Airbnb.

So I created a hack, https://www.gitsurf.com/, based entirely on Github, which has a very high barrier to entry.

https://www.gitsurf.com/pages/man has more information on the mechanics.

Would people here use it? Should it be entirely open sourced?

title: Could you guys review my first JavaScript project?
Ask HN: Tricks to disconnect from work while on vacation
text:
Lately, I'm finding it particularly difficult to disconnect from work. I've tried deleting work apps from my phone, but I still find myself reinstalling them to check something.

It's particularly annoying since I really want to disconnect and rest.

What are your best tricks? Do you have any particular routine during holidays that allows you to completely forget about work?

Show HN: Tutorial for making a browser-based multiplayer platformer with Hathora
text:
This tutorial features a fully authoritative server using arcade-physics[0] for physics and collision detection. It uses Phaser for the frontend and Hathora for the backend/multiplayer.

The full code is available on Github[1]. I was pretty happy with how minimal the code ended up being, and I hope this can be a useful resource for others interested in building a multiplayer platformer game!

[0] https://github.com/yandeu/arcade-physics [1] https://github.com/hathora/platformer-tutorial
